page.title: 02Industrial Archaeology
page.content: New Lanark is one of the most important sites in Scotland for industrial archeology. It is famous for its associations, during the industrial revolutin, with Robert Owen who put into practice some experiments to see how men and women would sdjust to the new machines and the factory life. The cotton mills were built in New Lanark on the River Clyde deep in the wooded gorge of the river close to the beautiful Falls of Clyde nature reserve, which is upstream of the village. In the village you can see a store, a nursery for 300 poor children and a school. There is also a building called the Institute for the Formation of Character. The working conditions in New Lanark were considered to be very good for their times.
